criteria: Understanding of Fraction Equivalence and Whole Numbers
Comparison of Fractions and Reasoning About Size
descriptions: Student does not demonstrate understanding of fraction equivalence or how whole numbers can be expressed as fractions.
Student struggles to explain fraction equivalence and has difficulty expressing whole numbers as fractions.
Student can explain fraction equivalence in simple cases but struggles with more complex examples. Shows basic understanding of expressing whole numbers as fractions.
Student can explain fraction equivalence in most cases and accurately expresses whole numbers as fractions. Demonstrates understanding with some examples.
Student clearly explains fraction equivalence, including special cases, and accurately expresses whole numbers as fractions. Provides clear examples and reasoning.
Student demonstrates a thorough understanding of fraction equivalence, including complex cases, and fluently expresses whole numbers as fractions. Provides insightful examples and justifications.
Student cannot compare fractions or reason about their relative size.
Student struggles to compare fractions and lacks understanding of relative size.
Student can compare some fractions with common denominators but struggles with different denominators. Limited reasoning about size.
Student can compare fractions and reason about their size using basic strategies such as common denominators or numerators. Shows understanding with number line diagrams.
Student compares fractions effectively and provides clear reasoning about their size using multiple strategies. Can accurately locate fractions on a number line.

Student demonstrates a deep understanding of comparing fractions and provides sophisticated reasoning about their size. Can use number line diagrams and other models effectively to justify comparisons.
Student does not demonstrate the ability to use a number line to represent fractions or whole numbers.
Student struggles to place fractions or whole numbers accurately on a number line.
Student can place simple fractions and whole numbers on a number line with some inaccuracies.
Student accurately places fractions and whole numbers on a number line, demonstrating understanding of their relative position.
Student skillfully uses a number line to represent and compare fractions and whole numbers, showing clear understanding of scale and proportion.
Student expertly uses a number line to represent and analyze fractions and whole numbers, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of their properties and relationships.
